intro: Euphrasia alpina vidalii, commonly known as the Alpine Eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Euphrasia alpina vidalii is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported soothing properties.
